Question: OPAA-01: Can you enforce password/passphrase aging requirements for administrative and/or system accounts?

Question: OPAA-02: Does your web-based interface support authentication, including standards-based single-sign-on? (e.g. InCommon)

Question: OPAA-04: Does the system support role based access control?

Question: OPAA-05: Are audit logs available that include AT LEAST all of the following; login, logout, actions performed, and source IP address?

Question: OPAA-07: Does your application and/or user-frontend/portal support multi-factor authentication? (e.g. Duo, Google Authenticator, OTP, etc.)

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - On-Prem (v2.11)

Question: OPCH-02: Will the institution be notified of major changes to your environment that could impact the institution's security posture?

Question: OPCH-03: Do you publish workarounds for how security risks can be mitigated until patches can be applied?

Question: OPCH-04: Do procedures exist to provide that emergency changes are documented and authorized (including after the fact approval)?

Question: OPDB-01: Does the database support encryption of specified data elements in storage?

Question: OPDB-02: Do you currently use encryption in your database(s)?

Question: OPDC-01: Do you provide your product as a virtual appliance?

Question: OPDC-04: For installable packages, do you perform regression testing against supported host OS systems?

Question: OPDC-05: Is sensitive data encrypted in transport? (e.g. system-to-client)

Question: OPDC-06: Is sensitive data encrypted in storage (e.g. disk encryption, at-rest)?

Question: OPDC-07: Do you employ or allow any cryptographic modules that do not conform to the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS PUB 140-2)?
